shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 2r [misplaced], 7r-7v), - Canon tables (fols. 2v-5v) - The “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 8ra-9ra) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 9va-80vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fols. 9va-10vb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 11ra-80vb) - Short postscript (fol. 80vb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 81ra-125ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fols. 81ra-81vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 83ra-125ra) - Short postscript (fol. 125ra) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 125rb-202va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 84 titles (fols. 125rb-126vb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 128ra-202va) - Short postscript (fol. 202va) V) Gospel of John (fols.202vb-260vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fols. 202vb-203ra) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 204ra-260rb) - Postscript (fols. 260rb-260vb, 261)
Additiones 1-11.

dcomments.dcomment: Mid-14th - mid-15th cent.(?) The earliest king mentioned in Additio 2 is Säyfä ʾArʿad (r. 1344-71), but the note may be posterior to his time. Other Additiones mention King Bäʾǝdä Maryam (r. 1468-78) and King Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl (r. 1508-40).

txstates.txstate: The first two quires are incomplete, some fols. (probably those with miniatures) are missing. Fol.61 (Jn. 17:10-24) has been severed from the counterpart and misplaced; it must be between fol. 249v and 250r.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired; the back board is probably of later time). Blind tooled reddish-brown leather cover has been preserved only on the inner sides of the front and back boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather turn-ins (only one tool is visible: two line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Parchment pastedowns on the inner sides of both boards. The frond board has three pairs of holes, close to the right upper and both bottom corners. Two metal pegs are inserted in the outer edge of the front board.

squires.squire:
I(5/fols. 1r-5v) – II(2/fols. 6r-7v) – III(8/fols. 8r-15v) – IV(7/fols. 16r-22v) – V(10/fols. 23r-32v) – VI(6/fols. 33r-38v) – VII(7/fols. 39r-45v) – VIII(8/fols. 46r-53v) – IX(8/fols. 54r-61v) – X(8/fols. 62r-69v) – XI(8/fols. 70r-77v) – XII(8/fols. 78r-85v) – XIII(8/fols. 86r-93v) – XIV(8/fols. 94r-101v) – XV(8/fols. 102r-109v) – XVI(8/fols. 110r-117v) – XVII(10/fols. 118r-127v) – XVIII(7/fols. 128r-134v) – XIX(9/fols. 135r-142v) – XX(8/fols. 143r-151v) – XXI(8/fols. 152r-159v) – XXII(8/fols. 160r-167v) – XXIIII(10/fols. 168r-177v) – XXIV(8/fols. 178r-185v) – XXV(8/fols. 186r-193v) – XXVI(8/fols. 194r-201v) – XXVII(8/fols. 202r-209v) – XXVIII(6/fols. 210r-215v) – XXIX(2/fols. 216r-217v) – XXX(8/fols. 218r-225v) – XXXI(8/fols. 226r-233v) – XXXII(8/fols. 234r-241v) – XXXIII(8/fols. 242r-249v) – XXXIV(7/fols. 250r-256v) – XXXV(7/fols. 257r-263v)
The first two quires are incomplete, some fols. are missing.

taunit.mr-info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel (fol. 12r).
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Incipits and headings of the texts; numerals, titles of the chapters written in the margins; numbers of the “tituli”; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals; on the incipit page of each Gospel, a few lines are rubricated (in groups of two lines, alternating with black lines); crux ansata.

additional.cont: Fol. 82ra: Inventory of items donated to Qәfrәya by Tänśәˀa Krәstos in the time of King Bäˀәdä Maryam.
additional.det: The note is written in a crude hand; it mentions King Bäʾәdä Maryam (r. 1468-78).

additional.cont: Fol. 82va: Inventory of items donated to Qәfrәya by King Säyfä ˀArˁad, an unnamed "head of the monastery", and mälake baḥər Bəlän Sägäda.
additional.det: The note is written in a trained hand; it describes a rich donation to the church of Qәfrәya made by King Säyfä ʾArʿad (r. 1344-71) and others. The hand appears old, but it is questionable if it can be dated to Säyfä ʾArʿad’s period.

additional.cont: Fol. 82vb: Record concerning donation to Qәfrәya made by Tänśәˀa Krәstos.
additional.det: Written in the same crude, old hand as Additio 1.

additional.cont: Fol. 126vb: Directive for the ministers.
Fol. 127ra-b: Inventory of the books and holy utensils (of Qәfreya ˁUra Mäsqäl?).
additional.det: The note is written in a 15th-cent. hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 127va: Inventory of donated items (?).
additional.det: The text of the note is abraded, for the most part poorly legible.

additional.add: Fol. 127vb:  በዘሀሎነ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡...
additional.det: Written in the same hand as Additio 4. The record refers to 306 year of mercy, the year of Mark, which can be 1654 A.D.

additional.cont: Fol. 202va: Record concerning land possession and tributes Qәfrәya ˁUra Mäsqäl.
Fol. 260vb: Inventory of items donated to several churches.
Fol. 262r: Record concerning a land grant of King Lәbnä Dәngәl (r. 1508-40) for commemoration (täzkar) of qäys ḥaḍäy ˀAskal.
Fol. 263ra: Record concerning the commemoration of nәburä ˀәd Tänśәˀa Krәstos and Sämrä Krәstos (7 Gәnbot).
additional.det: The note tells that the "book" was commissioned by the “children of Qәfrәya”, to commemorate, on the 7th of Gǝnbot nәburä ʾәd ʾabunä Tänśәʾa Krәstos and Yәsahlännä Krәstos.

additional.cont: Fol. 263ra-b: Inventory of books of the church of Qәfrәya ˁUra Mäsqäl.
additional.det: The note is written in the same hand as Additio 7 and the directive for the ministers on fol. 126vb.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quire marks decorated with crux ansata and coronis, in the most cases written in the inner corner of the upper margin, on the first and the last fol. of the quire (in a few cases might be covered by parchment guards): fols. 15v, 16r, 23v, 31v, 32r, 45v, 53v, 54r, 61v, 62r, 70r, 77v, 78r, 83r, 85v, 86r, 93v, 94r, 101v, 109v, 110r, 117v, 118r, 128r, 135v, 136r, 143v, 144r, 151v, 152r, 159v, 160v, 167v, 168r, 177v, 178r, 186r, 193v, 194r, 204r, 218r, 225v, 226r. - On some fols., the decoration for the quire mark is present but the number is missing: fols. 234r, 241v, 242r, 249v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Coloured and white threads are inserted in the edges of some folios.
